conversion_verification.notes: The second image is a true cutaway 3D model: walls have height and thickness, rooms read as volumetric spaces, and the view is clearly angled/isometric with the ceiling removed.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear wall height/thickness, good corner geometry, distinct floor plane, and clean cutaway; slight simplification of some wall tops/edges and openings prevents a perfect score.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall layout matches well (kitchen/dining-left, living-center, two bedrooms-right, bath/closets center-bottom, laundry-left-bottom). Minor discrepancies in some door/window placements and/or counts compared to the 2D plan.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture and fixtures are present (dining set, sofa/coffee table, beds, laundry machines, toilet/sink/tub). Kitchen is simplified but recognizable; some elements are minimal/abstract.

visual_clarity.notes: Readable geometry with consistent materials and no obvious broken meshes; lighting is neutral and interior remains visible. Dark background is clean and unobtrusive.

detected_errors.description: Some door/window opening locations/counts appear slightly inconsistent with the 2D plan (minor mismatches rather than missing major rooms).
Furniture and kitchen cabinetry/appliances are simplified, reducing room-identity certainty in a few areas.

summary: A clear, true 3D cutaway conversion with strong overall layout fidelity to the 2D plan, with only minor opening-placement and simplification issues.
